10000.name: Head
10000.caption: Bare head with no armor equipped.

10100.name: Body
10100.caption: Bare torso with no armor equipped.

10200.name: Arms
10200.caption: Bare arms with no armor equipped.

10300.name: Legs
10300.caption: Bare legs with no armor equipped.

40000.name: Iron Helmet
40000.caption:
An iron helmet showing rust on its edges.

Cloth covering the mouth and neck provides some resistance to poison and other irritants.

40100.name: Scale Armor
40100.caption:
Armor reinforced with small metal scales.

The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.

40300.name: Leather Trousers
40300.caption:
Well-made leather trousers.

The lower legs are each bound in cord for ease of movement.

50000.name: Kaiden Helm
50000.caption:
Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

50100.name: Kaiden Armor
50100.caption:
Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords.
Made with the pelt of a snow-wolf, which protects against the cold.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

50200.name: Kaiden Gauntlets
50200.caption:

60000.name: Drake Knight Helm
60000.caption:
Black iron helm worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

60100.name: Drake Knight Armor
60100.caption:
Black iron armor worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

The cape is crafted with dragon wing membrane.

60200.name: Drake Knight Gauntlets
60200.caption:
Black iron gauntlets worn by drake knights.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.

80000.name: Scaled Helm
80000.caption:
Helm worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

80100.name: Scaled Armor
80100.caption:

90000.name: Perfumer Hood
90000.caption:
Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

90100.name: Perfumer Robe
90100.caption:
Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

90200.name: Perfumer Gloves
90200.caption:
Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

90300.name: Perfumer Sarong
90300.caption:

100000.name: Traveler's Hat
100000.caption:
Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

100100.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb
100100.caption:
Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

100200.name: Traveler's Gloves
100200.caption:
Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

120000.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
120000.caption:
Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

120100.name: Alberich's Robe
120100.caption:
Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

130000.name: Spellblade's Pointed Hat
130000.caption:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

130100.name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire
130100.caption:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

140000.name: Bull-Goat Helm
140000.caption:
Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

140100.name: Bull-Goat Armor
140100.caption:
Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

140200.name: Bull-Goat Gauntlets
140200.caption:

150000.name: Iron Kasa
150000.caption:
Iron kasa of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Crafted to imitate the woven straw hats worn in the Land of Reeds.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

150100.name: Ronin's Armor
150100.caption:
Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

150200.name: Ronin's Gauntlets
150200.caption:

160000.name: Guilty Hood
160000.caption:
Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown.

The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.

160100.name: Cloth Garb
160100.caption: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

160200.name: Tarnished Wrap
160200.caption:
Arm wraps made of coarse material.
Garb of spurned Tarnished who were
forced into slavery in the Lands Between.

160300.name: Cloth Trousers
160300.caption: Trousers made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

170000.name: Black Wolf Mask
170000.caption:
A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.

Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.

170100.name: Blaidd's Armor
170100.caption:
Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.

The pelt serves as a cape, protecting from cold.
Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway.

170200.name: Blaidd's Gauntlets
170200.caption:
Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

170300.name: Blaidd's Greaves
170300.caption:
Well-worn black greaves of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

171100.name: Blaidd's Armor (Altered)
171100.caption:

180000.name: Black Knife Hood
180000.caption:
Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

180100.name: Black Knife Armor
180100.caption:
Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound.

Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

180200.name: Black Knife Gauntlets
180200.caption:
Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins.
Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

180300.name: Black Knife Greaves
180300.caption:
Greaves used by the Black Knife Assassins.
Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

190000.name: Exile Hood
190000.caption:
Deep red hood that covers the whole head.

Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

190100.name: Exile Armor
190100.caption:
Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

190200.name: Exile Gauntlets
190200.caption:
Damaged iron gauntlets.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

190300.name: Exile Greaves
190300.caption:
Damaged iron greaves.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

200000.name: Banished Knight Helm
200000.caption:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.

200100.name: Banished Knight Armor
200100.caption:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

200200.name: Banished Knight Gauntlets
200200.caption:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
These gauntlets were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

210000.name: Briar Helm
210000.caption:
Battered iron helm from a foreign land.
Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death.
Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

220000.name: Page Hood
220000.caption:
Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

220100.name: Page Garb
220100.caption:
Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

220300.name: Page Trousers
220300.caption:

230000.name: Night's Cavalry Helm
230000.caption:
Pitch-black helm with flowing black hair.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

230100.name: Night's Cavalry Armor
230100.caption:
Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

240000.name: Blue Silver Mail Hood
240000.caption:
Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

240100.name: Blue Silver Mail Armor
240100.caption:

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

240200.name: Blue Silver Bracelets
240200.caption:

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

250000.name: Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau
250000.caption:
Chapeau of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

250100.name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery
250100.caption:
Finery of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

260000.name: Malformed Dragon Helm
260000.caption:
A malformed golden helm.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

260100.name: Malformed Dragon Armor
260100.caption:
Malformed golden armor.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

270000.name: Tree Sentinel Helm
270000.caption:
Golden helm of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Very few are permitted to wear a golden wood crest of such size as seen on this helm.

270100.name: Tree Sentinel Armor
270100.caption:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

270200.name: Tree Sentinel Gauntlets
270200.caption:
Golden gauntlets of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

271100.name: Tree Sentinel Armor (Altered)
271100.caption:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

280000.name: Royal Knight Helm
280000.caption:
Silver helm of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

280100.name: Royal Knight Armor
280100.caption:
Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta was once a royal Carian knight, and her lapis-lazuli blue cape is the emblem of the knightly pride that continues to guide her.

280200.name: Royal Knight Gauntlets
280200.caption:
Silver gauntlets of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

280300.name: Royal Knight Greaves
280300.caption:
Silver greaves of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

281100.name: Royal Knight Armor (Altered)
281100.caption:
Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

290000.name: Nox Monk Hood
290000.caption:
Silk hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

290100.name: Nox Monk Armor
290100.caption:
Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

290200.name: Nox Monk Bracelets
290200.caption:
Bracelets worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

290300.name: Nox Monk Greaves
290300.caption:
Greaves worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

291000.name: Nox Monk Hood (Altered)
291000.caption:
Hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

291100.name: Nox Monk Armor (Altered)
291100.caption:
Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

292000.name: Nox Swordstress Crown
292000.caption:
Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

292100.name: Nox Swordstress Armor
292100.caption:
Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and wear silk capes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

293000.name: Night Maiden Twin Crown
293000.caption:
Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City.
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

293100.name: Night Maiden Armor
293100.caption:
Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City.
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

294000.name: Nox Swordstress Crown (Altered)
294000.caption:
Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
The silk eye covering is removed, flaunting convention.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

294100.name: Nox Swordstress Armor (Altered)
294100.caption:
Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

300000.name: Great Horned Headband
300000.caption:
Headband decorated by a pair of great horns.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

300100.name: Fur Raiment
300100.caption:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

300300.name: Fur Leggings
300300.caption:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

301000.name: Shining Horned Headband
301000.caption:
Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.

301100.name: Shaman Furs
301100.caption:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

301300.name: Shaman Leggings
301300.caption:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

310000.name: Duelist Helm
310000.caption:
Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

310100.name: Gravekeeper Cloak
310100.caption:
Thick, bristly cloak that is the symbol of an underground gravekeeper.

Those who once fought for a living were driven from the colosseum, and becoming guardians of Erdtree Burial.

310300.name: Duelist Greaves
310300.caption:
Greaves encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

311100.name: Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered)
311100.caption:
Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

320000.name: Sanguine Noble Hood
320000.caption:
Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

320100.name: Sanguine Noble Robe
320100.caption:
Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

320300.name: Sanguine Noble Waistcloth
320300.caption:
Waistcloth sewn from black cloth.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

330000.name: Guardian Mask
330000.caption:
Engraved golden mask.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

330100.name: Guardian Garb (Full Bloom)
330100.caption:
Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation.

It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already.

330200.name: Guardian Bracers
330200.caption:
Engraved golden bracers.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

330300.name: Guardian Greaves
330300.caption:
Engraved golden greaves.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

331100.name: Guardian Garb
331100.caption:
Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

340000.name: Cleanrot Helm
340000.caption:
Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

340100.name: Cleanrot Armor
340100.caption:
Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

340200.name: Cleanrot Gauntlets
340200.caption:
Gauntlets of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

340300.name: Cleanrot Greaves
340300.caption:
Greaves of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

341000.name: Cleanrot Helm (Altered)
341000.caption:
Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

341100.name: Cleanrot Armor (Altered)
341100.caption:
Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

350000.name: Fire Monk Hood
350000.caption:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

350100.name: Fire Monk Armor
350100.caption:
Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The grotesque face sculpted on the chest is said to depict the corrupt ancient god of the flame.
Taboos transform into lasting obsessions by virtue of the fear that they inspire.

350200.name: Fire Monk Gauntlets
350200.caption:
Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

350300.name: Fire Monk Greaves
350300.caption:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

351000.name: Blackflame Monk Hood
351000.caption:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

351100.name: Blackflame Monk Armor
351100.caption:
Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

351200.name: Blackflame Monk Gauntlets
351200.caption:
Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

351300.name: Blackflame Monk Greaves
351300.caption:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

360000.name: Fire Prelate Helm
360000.caption:
Helm engraved with a sacred countenance and housing a cauldron.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

It is said the cauldron perched atop the head was originally furnished with embers, and would surge into flames when the wearer's faith reached its zenith. The fire of this cauldron has since died out, however.

360100.name: Fire Prelate Armor
360100.caption:
Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

360200.name: Fire Prelate Gauntlets
360200.caption:
Black iron gauntlets with the appearance of flames.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

360300.name: Fire Prelate Greaves
360300.caption:
Black iron greaves with the appearance of flames.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

361100.name: Fire Prelate Armor (Altered)
361100.caption:
Black iron armor.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

370000.name: Aristocrat Headband
370000.caption:
Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

370100.name: Aristocrat Garb
370100.caption:
High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

370300.name: Aristocrat Boots
370300.caption:
Boots made from tanned leather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

371100.name: Aristocrat Garb (Altered)
371100.caption:

Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

380000.name: Aristocrat Hat
380000.caption:
Leather hat decorated with a withered feather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

380100.name: Aristocrat Coat
380100.caption:
Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

390000.name: Old Aristocrat Cowl
390000.caption:
Cowl made of soft cloth.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

390100.name: Old Aristocrat Gown
390100.caption:
Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

390300.name: Old Aristocrat Shoes
390300.caption:
Hard-wearing shoes made of leather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

420000.name: Vulgar Militia Helm
420000.caption:
Helm worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

The upward extension serves to create an appearance of larger size, however slightly.

420100.name: Vulgar Militia Armor
420100.caption:
Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

420200.name: Vulgar Militia Gauntlets
420200.caption:
Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

420300.name: Vulgar Militia Greaves
420300.caption:
Greaves worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

430000.name: Sage Hood
430000.caption:
A burgundy pointed hood.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

430100.name: Sage Robe
430100.caption:
Thick burgundy robe.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

430300.name: Sage Trousers
430300.caption:
Thick burgundy trousers.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

440000.name: Pumpkin Helm
440000.caption:
An oval helm large enough to cover any head.
Very heavy and very hard.

Reduces damage from headshots and impacts.

The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking.
Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.

460000.name: Elden Lord Crown
460000.caption:
Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

460100.name: Elden Lord Armor
460100.caption:
Armor of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

460200.name: Elden Lord Bracers
460200.caption:
Bracers of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

460300.name: Elden Lord Greaves
460300.caption:
Greaves of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

461100.name: Elden Lord Armor (Altered)
461100.caption:
Armor of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

470000.name: Radahn's Redmane Helm
470000.caption:
Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair.
Worn by General Radahn.

Radahn inherited the furious, flaming red hair of his father Radagon, and is fond of its heroic implications.

"I was born a champion's cub. Now I am the Lord of the Battlefield's lion."

470100.name: Radahn's Lion Armor
470100.caption:
Armor depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

470200.name: Radahn's Gauntlets
470200.caption:
Gauntlets depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

470300.name: Radahn's Greaves
470300.caption:
Greaves depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

471100.name: Radahn's Lion Armor (Altered)
471100.caption:
Armor depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

480100.name: Lord of Blood's Robe
480100.caption:
Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth.

The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

481100.name: Lord of Blood's Robe (Altered)
481100.caption:
Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth.

The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

510000.name: Queen's Crescent Crown
510000.caption:
A tall crown depicting the moon.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

510100.name: Queen's Robe
510100.caption:
Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

510200.name: Queen's Bracelets
510200.caption:
Bracelets indicating the highest order of sorcerer.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

510300.name: Queen's Leggings
510300.caption:
Leggings indicating the highest order of sorcerer.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

520000.name: Godskin Apostle Hood
520000.caption:
Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Worn by the Godskin Apostles.

The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

520100.name: Godskin Apostle Robe
520100.caption:
Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Worn by the Godskin Apostles.

The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

520200.name: Godskin Apostle Bracelets
520200.caption:
Black bracelets of the Godskin Apostles.

The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

520300.name: Godskin Apostle Trousers
520300.caption:
Trousers made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Worn by the Godskin Apostles.

The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.

530000.name: Godskin Noble Hood
530000.caption:
Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft.
Worn by Godskin Nobles.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

530100.name: Godskin Noble Robe
530100.caption:
Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles, known for their seven-face aprons.

Strengthens the Noble Presence incantation.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

530200.name: Godskin Noble Bracelets
530200.caption:
Black bracelets of the Godskin Nobles.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

530300.name: Godskin Noble Trousers
530300.caption:
Trousers made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes them plump and soft.
Worn by Godskin Nobles.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

540000.name: Depraved Perfumer Headscarf
540000.caption:
Headscarf worn by depraved perfumers.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

540100.name: Depraved Perfumer Robe
540100.caption:
Robe worn by depraved perfumers.
The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

540200.name: Depraved Perfumer Gloves
540200.caption:
Gloves worn by depraved perfumers.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

540300.name: Depraved Perfumer Trousers
540300.caption:
Trousers worn by depraved perfumers.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

541100.name: Depraved Perfumer Robe (Altered)
541100.caption:
Robe worn by depraved perfumers.
The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

570000.name: Crucible Axe Helm
570000.caption:
Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The axe ornamentation is the knight Ordovis's mark, displayed also by his men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

570100.name: Crucible Axe Armor
570100.caption:
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

570200.name: Crucible Gauntlets
570200.caption:
Gauntlets of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

570300.name: Crucible Greaves
570300.caption:
Greaves of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

571000.name: Crucible Tree Helm
571000.caption:
Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The great tree ornamentation is the knight Siluria's mark, displayed also by her men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

571100.name: Crucible Tree Armor
571100.caption:
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Worn by the knight Siluria and her men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

572100.name: Crucible Axe Armor (Altered)
572100.caption:
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

573100.name: Crucible Tree Armor (Altered)
573100.caption:
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Worn by the knight Siluria and her men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

580000.name: Lusat's Glintstone Crown
580000.caption:
The giant blue glintstone crown worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

This crown replaced Lusat's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Lusat's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

580100.name: Lusat's Robe
580100.caption:
A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Corroded by blue glintstones.

Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.

580200.name: Lusat's Manchettes
580200.caption:
Manchettes corroded by blue glintstones.
Worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

Lusat had reached a near-inorganic state.

580300.name: Old Sorcerer's Legwraps
580300.caption:
Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs.
Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.

581000.name: Azur's Glintstone Crown
581000.caption:
Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.

This crown replaced Azur's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Azur's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

581100.name: Azur's Glintstone Robe
581100.caption:
A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Corroded by blue-green glintstones.

Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.

581200.name: Azur's Manchettes
581200.caption:
Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones.
Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer.

Azur had reached a near-inorganic state.

590000.name: All-Knowing Helm
590000.caption:
Helm set with countless eyes and ears.
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

590100.name: All-Knowing Armor
590100.caption:
Armor set with countless eyes and ears.
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

590200.name: All-Knowing Gauntlets
590200.caption:

At the end that should not be.

590300.name: All-Knowing Greaves
590300.caption:
Greaves set with countless eyes and ears.
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

591100.name: All-Knowing Armor (Altered)
591100.caption:
Armor set with countless eyes and ears.
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

600000.name: Twinned Helm
600000.caption:
Helm depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

The two known as D are inseparable twins.
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another.

Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

600100.name: Twinned Armor
600100.caption:
Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

The two known as D are inseparable twins.
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another.

610000.name: Ragged Hat
610000.caption: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal.

610100.name: Ragged Armor
610100.caption: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

610200.name: Ragged Gloves
610200.caption: Gauntlets pieced together from scavenged metal.

610300.name: Ragged Loincloth
610300.caption: Greaves pieced together from scavenged metal.

611000.name: Ragged Hat (Altered)
611000.caption: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal.

611100.name: Ragged Armor (Altered)
611100.caption: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

620000.name: Prophet Blindfold
620000.caption:
Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.

620100.name: Corhyn's Robe
620100.caption:
Robe of Corhyn the cleric.

Even after exile, Corhyn refused to recant his prophecies. And for this, he was blessed with the guidance of grace. 

Since then, the cart wheel draped on his neck has served as a reminder. That true guidance awaits those with iron wills. Those with unwavering faith.

620300.name: Prophet Trousers
620300.caption:
Trousers of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

621100.name: Prophet Robe (Altered)
621100.caption:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

622100.name: Prophet Robe
622100.caption:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

The shackles around the neck warn passersby not to lend an ear to their sermons.

630000.name: Astrologer Hood
630000.caption:
Hood fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

630100.name: Astrologer Robe
630100.caption:
Robe fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

630200.name: Astrologer Gloves
630200.caption:
Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

630300.name: Astrologer Trousers
630300.caption:
Trousers worn inside a robe.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

631100.name: Astrologer Robe (Altered)
631100.caption:
Robe fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

640000.name: Lionel's Helm
640000.caption:
Round iron helm with a distinctive large brim.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

640100.name: Lionel's Armor
640100.caption:
Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

640200.name: Lionel's Gauntlets
640200.caption:
Rounded iron gauntlets.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

640300.name: Lionel's Greaves
640300.caption:
Rounded iron greaves.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself her father.

641100.name: Lionel's Armor (Altered)
641100.caption:
Round iron armor.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

650000.name: Hoslow's Helm
650000.caption:
A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the revered House of Hoslow.

Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers.

His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.

650100.name: Hoslow's Armor
650100.caption:
Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

650200.name: Hoslow's Gauntlets
650200.caption:
Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

650300.name: Hoslow's Greaves
650300.caption:
Garish silver greaves decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

651000.name: Diallos's Mask
651000.caption:
Replica of a twin-tailed silver helm with flowery adornments. Only, without the twin tails.

Diallos Hoslow had an older brother who was a stern, self-possessed man of few words. His achievements made him seem out of reach.

And so the younger aspired to be like the older. Yearning for the day that he would tell the tale of House Hoslow, in blood. Knowing full well that it would break his brother's heart.

652100.name: Hoslow's Armor (Altered)
652100.caption:
Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

660000.name: Vagabond Knight Helm
660000.caption:
Helm of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The visor is broken and can no longer be lowered.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

660100.name: Vagabond Knight Armor
660100.caption:
Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

660200.name: Vagabond Knight Gauntlets
660200.caption:
Gauntlets of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

660300.name: Vagabond Knight Greaves
660300.caption:
Greaves of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

661100.name: Vagabond Knight Armor (Altered)
661100.caption:
Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

670000.name: Blue Cloth Cowl
670000.caption:
Cowl of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.

Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay.
Warriors must remain ever drifting.

670100.name: Blue Cloth Vest
670100.caption:
Vest of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.

Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay.
Warriors must remain ever drifting.

670200.name: Warrior Gauntlets
670200.caption:
Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior.
Crafted from sturdy leather.

670300.name: Warrior Greaves
670300.caption:
Greaves of a nomadic warrior.
Crafted from sturdy leather.

680000.name: White Mask
680000.caption:
Bloodstained, faintly grinning white mask.
Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.

680100.name: War Surgeon Gown
680100.caption:
Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

680200.name: War Surgeon Gloves
680200.caption:
Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

680300.name: War Surgeon Trousers
680300.caption:
Bloodstained trousers of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

681100.name: War Surgeon Gown (Altered)
681100.caption:
Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

690000.name: Royal Remains Helm
690000.caption:
Helm graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

690100.name: Royal Remains Armor
690100.caption:
Armor graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

690200.name: Royal Remains Gauntlets
690200.caption:
Gauntlets graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

690300.name: Royal Remains Greaves
690300.caption:
Greaves graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

700000.name: Brave's Cord Circlet
700000.caption:
Warrior's headband of woven leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheat
often found hung from these headbands are
prayers of farewell from the people of their home.
In bidding farewell to warriors departing on
a journey from which they aren't like to return,
this small act offers only meager relief.

700100.name: Brave's Battlewear
700100.caption:
Battlewear fashioned from leather armor
adorned with a large sheet of cloth.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

The red cloth signifies participation in the
Long March long, long ago and this ceremonial
garb beseeches the favor of the Warrior King
who led them.

700200.name: Brave's Bracer
700200.caption:
Gauntlets wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Has a fur lining which excels at keeping
the cold at bay.

700300.name: Brave's Legwraps
700300.caption:
Greaves wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Has a fur lining which excels at keeping
the cold at bay.

701000.name: Brave's Leather Helm
701000.caption:
Battlewear wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

702000.name: Brave's Battlewear (Altered)
702000.caption:
Helm wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

720000.name: Beast Champion Helm
720000.caption:
Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

The beasts, their eyes and ears covered, represent an oath: "See nothing, hear nothing, doubt nothing, and carry on, along the path set in stone."

720100.name: Beast Champion Armor
720100.caption:
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

720200.name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
720200.caption:
Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

720300.name: Beast Champion Greaves
720300.caption:
Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

721100.name: Beast Champion Armor (Altered)
721100.caption:
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

730000.name: Champion Headband
730000.caption:
Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

730100.name: Champion Pauldron
730100.caption:
Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

730200.name: Champion Bracers
730200.caption:
Bracers reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

730300.name: Champion Gaiters
730300.caption:
Gaiters formed only with leather straps.
Common wear in the badlands.

740000.name: Crimson Hood
740000.caption:
A hooded cloak of vivid crimson.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
Increases vigor.

Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on journeys without specific orders, to faraway lands from which they would never return. In other words, the gift of a cloak made it easier for undesirables to be on their way. 

Roderika never once saw the guidance of grace.

740100.name: Noble's Traveling Garb
740100.caption:
Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

740200.name: Noble's Gloves
740200.caption:
Gloves of plush leather.
Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

740300.name: Noble's Trousers
740300.caption:
White trousers of superior craftsmanship.
Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

741000.name: Navy Hood
741000.caption:
A hooded cloak of deep navy.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
Increases mind.

Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?

760000.name: Maliketh's Helm
760000.caption:
Beast's helm made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

760100.name: Maliketh's Armor
760100.caption:
Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

760200.name: Maliketh's Gauntlets
760200.caption:
Beast's gauntlets made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

760300.name: Maliketh's Greaves
760300.caption:
Beast's greaves made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

761100.name: Maliketh's Armor (Altered)
761100.caption:
Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.

770000.name: Malenia's Winged Helm
770000.caption:
Winged helm made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

770100.name: Malenia's Armor
770100.caption:
Armor made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

770200.name: Malenia's Gauntlet
770200.caption:
Gauntlet made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

770300.name: Malenia's Greaves
770300.caption:
Greaves made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

771100.name: Malenia's Armor (Altered)
771100.caption:
Armor made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

780000.name: Veteran's Helm
780000.caption:
An old helm that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

780100.name: Veteran's Armor
780100.caption:
Old armor that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

780200.name: Veteran's Gauntlets
780200.caption:
Old gauntlets that have seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

780300.name: Veteran's Greaves
780300.caption:
Old greaves that have seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

781100.name: Veteran's Armor (Altered)
781100.caption:
Old armor that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

790000.name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
790000.caption:
Metal helm with a pointed beak.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

790100.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
790100.caption:
Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

790200.name: Bloodhound Knight Gauntlets
790200.caption:
Metal gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

790300.name: Bloodhound Knight Greaves
790300.caption:
Metal greaves of the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

791100.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor (Altered)
791100.caption:
Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

800000.name: Festive Hood
800000.caption:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Decorated with many-colored flowers.

800100.name: Festive Garb
800100.caption:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Faintly bloodstained.

801000.name: Festive Hood (Altered)
801000.caption:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Decorated with a stunning array of flowers.

801100.name: Festive Garb (Altered)
801100.caption:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Faintly bloodstained.

802000.name: Blue Festive Hood
802000.caption:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

802100.name: Blue Festive Garb
802100.caption:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Use of this garb, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

810000.name: Commoner's Headband
810000.caption:
A headband that holds cloth in place.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

810100.name: Commoner's Garb
810100.caption:
Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

810300.name: Commoner's Shoes
810300.caption:
Modest shoes made of cloth.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

811000.name: Commoner's Headband (Altered)
811000.caption:
A headband with the cloth removed.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

811100.name: Commoner's Garb (Altered)
811100.caption:
Garb decorated with intricate embroidery.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

812000.name: Commoner's Simple Garb
812000.caption:
Garb with a modest cloth cape attached.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

812100.name: Commoner's Simple Garb (Altered)
812100.caption:
Modest garb made of cloth.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

820000.name: Envoy Crown
820000.caption:
The soft bundle worn on the head by Oracle Envoys.
Densely wrapped in several layers of cloth.

Raises the potency of bubble-based skills.

No one knows what the cloth hides, but some claim to have heard a faint whimpering from inside. It must have been their imagination.

830000.name: Twinsage Glintstone Crown
830000.caption:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina.

Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.

830100.name: Raya Lucarian Robe
830100.caption:
Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.

Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep navy garb after making their vows of virtue and austerity.

But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

830200.name: Sorcerer Manchettes
830200.caption:
Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
